task.title: Vertica Integration for Developers (test Task layout)
task.shortdesc: How to create and integrate user-defined Vertica Technical Preview services.

ul.li: You already have an ALS cluster created.
You can access it to deploy applications.
You have allowed access to the Vertica instance or clustered IP addresses and Vertica port 5433 using the process available here.

context.p: Create a user-provided service in the ALS cluster.

step.cmd: Log in to the target ALS cluster using helion target and helion login.
step.stepxmp: Target the ALS cluster.$ helion target <ALS cluster end point>Log in.$ helion login

stepresult.codeblock: $ helion target api.15.124.133.173.xip.io Successfully targeted to [https://api.15.124.133.173.xip.io] Target: https://api.15.124.133.173.xip.io Organization: <none> Space: <none>

$ helion login Attempting login to [https://api.15.124.133.173.xip.io] Username: myuser@mycompany.com Password: Successfully logged into [https://api.15.124.133.173.xip.io] demo@hpe.com Choosing the one available organization: "default" Choosing the one available space: "default" Target: https://api.15.124.133.173.xip.io Organization: default Space: default

step.cmd: Retrieve a list of all services in the ALS cluster using helion services.

stepresult.p: On a new ALS cluster with no services created, you should see output similar to the following:

step.cmd: Create a new service for binding Vertica from applications in the ALS cluster.

stepxmp.codeblock: $ helion create-service user-provided <name of your Vertica service>

substep.cmd: You will be prompted for the field names to be used for Vertica connection credentials. For a single instance Vertica, provide field names such as: hostname,port,username,password,db.For a Vertica Preview cluster, for example with 3 nodes, provide field names such as: hostname,port,username,password,db (Hostname refers to the master node of the Vertica cluster.)
